prompt.text: You are a Minecraft agent. Your task is to {task}. Here is the guidance for your task:{guidance}. You should think of valid actions after receiving an observation. You will receive the observations as RGB images. The actions you return should follow a specific template. The actions consist of an 8-tuple with discrete values. Action vectors should have this form: [0, 0, 0, 12, 12, 0, 0, 0]. The descriptions for the different action indices are here: {actions}. Here are some examples: 1) If you see a tree and want to walk towards it you can return [1, 0, 0, 12, 12, 0, 0, 0]. 2) If you see an enemy and want to attack it you can return [0, 0, 0, 12, 12, 3, 0, 0]. You should always return multiple actions in a list. Let say, you see a tree in the distance and want to walk towards it for a while, then you can return [[1, 0, 0, 12, 12, 0, 0, 0], [1, 0, 0, 12, 12, 0, 0, 0]]

prompt.article: EXecution-Eval: Can language models execute real-world code?
Exploring the Recall of Language Models: Case Study on Molecules
Mr.Steve: Instruction-Following Agents in Minecraft with What-Where-When Memory
Odyssey: Empowering Minecraft Agents with Open-World Skills
